title: Top 10 Tips to Survive Winter in New York City
text:
He winter in NY It can be challenging, but with the right preparation, you can enjoy the city even in the coldest temperatures. Here are some tips practical to survive winter New Yorker:
1. Layers, layers and more layers
The winter climate of NY can change quickly, so you saw layers. Use thermal clothing, sweaters sheltered and coats resistant to the wind to keep you warm. Don’t forget a good pair of gloves, a scarf and a hat.
2. Sturdy footwear
New York streets can become slippery with the snow and ice. Opt for boots resistant waterproof and with good traction to avoid falls and keep your feet dry and sheltered.
3. Prepare for the storms of snow
NY You may experience heavy snowfall. Make sure you have a shovel to snow in casaand if possible, rent or buy boots for the snow. Also have salt on hand to melt ice and make sidewalks safer.
4. Use the transport public
Avoid walking long distances on extremely cold days. The metro and bus system NY It is extensive and allows you to move efficiently without directly facing inclement
weather.
5. Shelters urban: cafes and shops
Discover the city’s cozy cafes and shops. Many places offer shelter from the cold and are perfect for enjoying a hot drink while sheltering from the freezing wind.
6. Events winter
Take advantage of the events and activities of winter in the city. From Christmas markets to ice skating rinks, NY offers a wide variety of winter experiences to enjoy with friends and family.

7. Heating in casa
Make sure your home is well insulated and has insulation systems. heating efficient. Have extra blankets and be sure to seal out any drafts to keep warm.
8. Hydration and skin care fur
Cold air can dry out the fur, so don’t forget to hydrate and use protective creams. Use sunscreen, even on winterto protect you from harmful UV rays that can reflect off the snow.
9. Explore museums y galleries of art
Cold days are ideal for exploring the numerous museums y galleries of art NY. Immerse yourself in culture and art while sheltering from the winter
weather.
10. Planning for storms of snow
Anticipate the storms of snow and plan accordingly. Make sure you have non-perishable food, flashlights, batteries, and other essential supplies in case you face inclement
weather conditions.
With these tipsyou will be prepared to face the winter in NY and enjoy everything the city has to offer, even when the temperatures drop. May you have a winter warm and full of experiences in the Big Apple!
